title: Question 16
prompt: Early experiments to clone frogs resulted in tadpoles that did not grow into frogs. Fewer than a dozen species have been successfully cloned, and many clones die young. Which of the following questions best addresses these problems in cloning?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: As the diagram shows, genes are in an organism’s DNA, which is found in the organism’s chromosomes. Since chromosomes are an organism’s genetic code, if cloning a cell affects its chromosomes, then cloning might change its DNA. Changes to DNA could cause problems that would result in death. Answering this question may help scientists learn what causes the problems with cloning.
